body: Every time i try and paste something into the void, it ALWAYS pastes awkwardly...but its easy for me to paste on land....help?
body_tagged: Every time i try and paste something into the void, it ALWAYS pastes awkwardly...but its easy for me to paste on land....help?
title: how to paste in void?

replies.body: I could help if you were more descriptive... I don't really know what you are asking its pretty vague.
replies.body_tagged: I could help if you were more descriptive... I don't really know what you are asking its pretty vague.

replies.body:
ok, i copy something in a void world, i try and paste it, but its always like, 1 block under what i want. i want to make 2 monuments next to each other on floating islands, but when i try and paste, the thing i paste always paste in a place where i dont want it too.

(sorry if im typing like a retard, :c)
replies.body_tagged:
ok, i copy something in a void world, i try and paste it, but its always like, 1 block under what i want. i want to make 2 monuments next to each other on floating islands, but when i try and paste, the thing i paste always paste in a place where i dont want it too.

(sorry if im typing like a retard, :c)

replies.body:
Ok when you copy selected blocks it copies relative to where you are standing, so you just have to line up your paste correctly.

Basically if you are 50 blocks away when you copy it will paste 50 blocks away when you do //paste
replies.body_tagged:
Ok when you copy selected blocks it copies relative to where you are standing, so you just have to line up your paste correctly.

Basically if you are 50 blocks away when you copy it will paste 50 blocks away when you do //paste

replies.body: uhm ok i guess i have it now :o thx guyz

replies.body: If you have problems with the //copy and //paste, I would just use the //move command to move it however many blocks you need in any direction. That is what I use when I make an error copying and pasting.
replies.body_tagged: If you have problems with the //copy and //paste, I would just use the //move command to move it however many blocks you need in any direction. That is what I use when I make an error copying and pasting.

replies.body:
What I do :::3

1: Build a map on my server in multiplayer
2: Duplicate my already loaded air world in single player
3: Import the multiplayer world into singleplayer,
4: Copy and paste the map made in multiplayer using MCEdit into the singleplayer world  (Rotate/mirror and paste if not already done)
5: Done :O

http://www.mcedit.net/
I dont get what kind of assistance you need :c
